snippet: Islamist extremists have prompted more than 90,000 Malian refugees to flee into neighboring Mauritania, where they spoke of the turmoil that pushed them out.
abstract: Islamist extremists have prompted more than 90,000 Malian refugees to flee into neighboring Mauritania; refugees are too tired, hungry and ragged to celebrate their departure from the turmoil; all they can speak of is the fear that pushed them out and of the simmering civil war that appears to be looming.

byline.contributor: Marlise Simons contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Islamist extremists have prompted more than 90,000 Malian refugees to flee into neighboring Mauritania, where they spoke of the turmoil that pushed them out.
